title: Energy Saving System
text:
Smart Energy Management Panel with Custom Usage Limit and Load Monitoring     
 
Group  Members  Name  with  Roll No  , Section  & GL Name & Contact No:  
 
 
 
S.No  Name  Roll No Sec Phone Number  
1 ABDUL  SAMAD  KHAN(GL)  2021F -BCE-135 C 03320361015  
2 M.FAHAM  2021F -BCE-08 A 03343338890  
3 ISMAIL  KHAN  2021F -BCE-110 C 03313192494  
4 AIMA  TAHIR  2021F -BCE-245 C 03352421884  
 
1. Project  title 
 
 
 
 
 
 
2.Brief Project Desc ription  
 
The Smart Energy Management Panel  is an innovative solution designed to empower users with 
precise control over their electricity consumption. This advanced panel integrates seamlessly with a 
mobile application, allowing users to set custom usage limits and monitor their electricity usage in 
real time.  
Key Features:  
1. Custom Usage Limit Setting : 
o Users can easily set their desired electricity consumption limit (in terms of monetary 
value) via the mobile app. This feature allows for better budgeting and management of 
electricity expenses, ensuring that users do not exceed their predefined limits.  
2. Real-Time Load Monitoring : 
o The panel continuously monitors electricity usage, providing users with real -time data on 
their consumption. This information is displayed in the mobile app, enabling users to 
track how much electricity they are using and how much they have left from their set 
limit. 
3. Mobile App Integration : 
o The dedicated mobile app serves as the central control hub for the Smart Energy 
Management Panel. Through the app, users can:  
▪ Set and adjust their consumption limits.  
▪ View historical usage data and trends.  
▪ Receive notifications when they are approaching their usage limit.  
▪ Monitor the status of connected appliances and manage them remotely.  
4. Automated Load Control : 
o The panel is equipped with relays that allow it to automatically control power to 
connected appliances based on the user -defined limits. If the consumption approaches 
the set limit, the panel can cut off power to non -essential devices, helping users stay 
within their budget.  
 
 
 
SIR SYED  UNIVERSITY  OF ENGINEERING  & TECHNOLOGY  
COMPUTER  ENGINEERING DEPARTMENT  
Proposal  for the Final  Year  Project  Batch  2021f  
5. Energy Efficiency Suggestions : 
o The panel analyzes usage patterns and provides users with suggestions for improving 
energy efficiency. Tips may include optimal times for running certain appliances or 
recommendations for reducing overall consumption.  
6. User -Friendly Interface : 
o The mobile app features an intuitive interface that makes it easy for users to navigate 
and manage their electricity consumption. Clear graphics and real -time updates ensure 
users can make informed decisions about their energy usage.  
7. Alerts and Notifications : 
o Users receive timely alerts when their electricity consumption is nearing the set limit or 
when unusual usage patterns are detected. This feature helps users take proactive 
measures to avoid exceeding their budgets.  
o  
o

• Design  of the Meter:  Created  a prototype  design for  the advanced  meter.  
• Basic  Functionality  Testing:  Developed  initial  software  to monitor  consumption  and 
recharge balance.  
 
Full System  Integration:  Integrated  load monitoring  capabilities  with the meter.  
User  Interface  Development: Developed a  mobile  or web app for users  to monitor  usage,  
recharge,  and receive  suggestions.  
Alert System  Implementation:  Created  a notification  system  for low balance  and usage  patterns.

  User Engagement :

  Market Applicability :

  Regulatory Compliance : 
• Ensure safety standards and data privacy regulations are met.  
  Future Expansion : 
• Explore renewable energy integration and additional features.  
  Research and Development : 
• Continuously enhance the system and stay updated with technology trends.

title: Smart Indoor Plantation
text:
SIR SYED  UNIVERSITY  OF ENGINEERING  & TECHNOLOGY  
COMPUTER  ENGINEERING  DEPARTMENT  
Proposal  for the Final  Year  Project  Batch  2020   
 
1. PROPOSED  TITLE  
“SMART  HYDROPONICS  MANAGEMENT  SYSTEM”  
 
2. How  would  you categorize  this project?  [Tick  only ONE]  
a. An effort  to facilitate  an existing  Research/ Industry  Project  
b. An effort to  facilitate developing a Research/ Industry Funded Proposal for possible  
Funding  
c. An effort to  facilitate  Master’s/ PhD  project  objectives  
d. An exploratory  study  
e. An experimental  study  for better  lab utilization/  development  
f. A capstone  project  for students allowing  them  to apply  their learning  
g. Other  (please  specify):     
 
3. What  characteristics  of the Complex  Engineering  Problem  (CEP)  are applicable  to 
this project?  [Tick  one or more,  if applicable]  
a. Range  of conflicting  requirements:  technical,  engineering  or other  issues.  
b. Depth  of analysis  required:  have  no obvious  solution  and require  abstract  thinking  
c. Depth of  knowledge  required:  require  research -based  knowledge  
d. Familiarity  of issues:  Involve  infrequently  encountered  issues  
e. Extent  of applicable  codes:  standards  and codes  devised  by the professional  bodies  
f. Extent  of stakeholder  involvement  and level of conflicting  requirements  
g. Consequences:  Impact  over the society  
h. Interdependence:  problems  due to dependability  
 
4. BREIF  OUTLINE  
 
Automation  of hydroponics  involves manipulating its control  variables such as  moisture  content,  humidity,  
temperature,  PH, TDS,  light intensity  etc.) to produce  the ideal  and optimum  environment  for any plant’s  
growth  and nurturing.  The aim of hydroponics  automation  is to minimize  labor  cost and increase  production  
substantially,  resulting  in economic  benefit  for our Country.  For this purpose,  we have  designed  hydroponic  
system.  After  analysis  of different  types  of materials,  selection  of ideal  materials  was made  for this 
application.  Electricity  is supplied  to our system  using  solar  panels.  Sensor  nodes  at different  places  in 
system  are installed  to provide  more  accurate  knowledge  about  our control  variables  so that optimum  
adjustment  can be applied  to each  area in green  house).  By using  Arduino,  green  house  is automated  by 
sending  appropriate  instructions  to actuators  for adjusting  control  variables.  For example,  when  soil moisture  
is low, it is enhanced  by using  water  sprinkler  system.  To notify  the user about  any emergency,  an IOT 
based  system  has been  installed  to extract  data on web server  and an Android  app has also been  designed  
for control  and monitor  of the system.  The costs  of this project  is kept low without  compromising  on efficiency  
and performance,  thus,  to provide  a solution  suitable  for both industry  and farmers.  The technique  used  in 
this greenhouse  chamber  to grow  plants  is known  as hydroponics.  The hydroponics  technique  is usually  
used  to grow  shallow  roots  plants  and leafy plants  such  as tomato,  capsicum,  cucumber,  spinach,  lettuce,  
mint,  coriander,  strawberry  and other  such  kind of plants.  The main  goal of this project  is to create  a 
greenhouse  chamber  that will produce  vegetables  and herbs  round  the year.  
SIR SYED  UNIVERSITY  OF ENGINEERING  & TECHNOLOGY  
COMPUTER  ENGINEERING  DEPARTMENT  
Proposal  for the Final  Year  Project  Batch  2020   
5. OBJECTIVES  
 To grow  plants  using  hydroponic  system.  
 To monitor  real time condition  soil moisture,  humidity  and temperature  of area using  the 
device  
 To test the functionality  of this project  by implementing  it in suitable  condition.  
 Human  intervention  reduction  is the main  purpose  of this project.  
 To get notified  when someone  will get close  to the plant.  
 To provide  cost effective  and user friendly  system.  


6. SCOPE  
Our main  scope  of this project  is create  a system  that let anyone  have  the ability  to grow  plants  
using  an automated  indoor system.  
Wireless  update.  
Less  expensive.  
Requires  low maintenance.  
 
7. METHODOLOGY  
 
ENVIRONMENTAL  REQUIREMENT  OF PLANTS: - 
We can control  temperature  and humidity  according  to the requirement  through  Dht22  temperature  and 
humidity  sensor.  
 
 
NUTRIENTS  REQUIREMENTS  OF PLANTS: - 
In hydroponic  system  nutrient  is directly  feed to the plant  roots,  so it is very necessary  to continuously                                                                                                                                                                
monitoring  the parameter  of nutrients  and any of them  is not match  it directly  affect  the plants  roots  
and also the growth.  The parameter  which  can monitored  is PH, TDSand  E . 
 
CONTROLLING: - 
The controlling  of the whole  process  can be done  by using  Arduino  mega  2560  with the help of relay  modules.  
The dht22,  PH, TDS and water  level are attached  to them.  The growing  led are to be controlled  because  
plants  don’t  need  light for 24 hours.  
SIR SYED  UNIVERSITY  OF ENGINEERING  & TECHNOLOGY  
COMPUTER  ENGINEERING  DEPARTMENT  
Proposal  for the Final  Year  Project  Batch  2020   
 
8. EXPECTED  OUTCOME  OF THE PROPOSED  PROJECT  
 There  is no need  for client  to manually  monitor  for the plant’s  condition  and it will reduce  
human’s  effort/work.  
 Provide  precise  climatic  conditions  for the plant,  water  the plants  automatically  while  the 
owner  wasn’t  there.  
 Data  may be accessible  in real time from anywhere  and at any time,  allowing  for live 
monitoring and  end-to-end communication  among  all parties  involved.  
 
9. EXPECTED  BUDGET  
60 Thousand  rupees.  
 
10. ATTACH  GANTT  CHART  OF FOR  THE PROJECT  WORK  
 
 

SIR SYED  UNIVERSITY  OF ENGINEERING  & TECHNOLOGY  
COMPUTER  ENGINEERING  DEPARTMENT  
Proposal  for the Final  Year  Project  Batch  2020   
11. HARDWARE  USED  
 Arduino  Mega2560  
 UNO  R3 + esp8266  
 WiFi  module  
 PH sensor  
 TDS  sensor  
 4-Relay  module  
 Growing  LED  strips  
 Servo  motor  
 DHT 22 humidity  and temperature  sensor  
 DC pumps  12v and 1A 
 DC fans  12V and 3.6A  
 Solar  panel 170W  
 MPPT  solar  battery  charger  
 Battery  100Ah  
 Light  sensor  
 Level  sensor  
 DC jumper  wires  3A 
 
12. SOFTWARE  TOOLS  USED  
We will  make  our own Web  Based  Application  which  will include:  
 HTML -CSS 
 JavaScript  
 PHP 
 Node  JS 
 DataBase(SQL/MongoDB)  
 
13. ALIGNMENT  OF PROJECT  WITH  DEPARTMENTAL/PROGRAMME  MISSION  AND  SDGS . 
 Life on  Land: - 
Our project  “Smart Hydroponics  System”  fulfills the goal  Life on Land because  
hydroponics  is a fastest  growing  sector  of agriculture  which  dominate  food 
production  in the future.  As population  increases  and arable  land declines  due 
to poor land management,  people  will turn to new technologies  like hydroponics  
and vertica l farming  to create  additional  channels  of crop production.  
SIR SYED  UNIVERSITY  OF ENGINEERING  & TECHNOLOGY  
COMPUTER  ENGINEERING  DEPARTMENT  
Proposal  for the Final  Year  Project  Batch  2020
